intro: Chamaegyne pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its spatulate leaves and inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests, where it thrives in the understory. Its rhizomes are edible and have been used traditionally for their starchy content. Due to its small size and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
